rules.title: Acknowledge Request & Identify Patient Type
rules.action: Acknowledge the request and determine if the patient is new or established.
rules.example: Hello, thank you for calling. Are you a new patient or have you visited us before?

rules.title: Request Established Patient ID
rules.action: Request identifying information (e.g., phone number, date of birth, name) to access their records.
rules.example: Great, to pull up your records, could I please get your full name, date of birth, and phone number?

rules.title: Inform About Chart Retrieval
rules.condition: Identifying information received from an established patient
rules.action: Inform the customer about chart retrieval and potential brief hold.
rules.example: Thank you. I'm just retrieving your chart now, which might take a moment. Please bear with me.

rules.title: Confirm Appointment Reason
rules.condition: Patient type identified and/or basic identification gathered
rules.action: Confirm the specific medical process or reason for the appointment.
rules.example: And what is the reason for your visit today, or what medical process you are looking to schedule?

rules.title: Inquire About Availability
rules.action: Inquire about the patient's preferred availability (days/times) for scheduling.
rules.example: What days and times work best for you for this appointment?

rules.title: Offer Specific Appointment Times
rules.condition: Patient has stated their preferred availability (e.g., days, times of day).
rules.action: Present specific appointment slots that align with the patient's stated preferences, retrieved from the scheduling system.
rules.example: You mentioned you prefer afternoons. I have an opening next Tuesday at 2:00 PM or Thursday at 3:30 PM. Do either of those work?

rules.title: Provide Multiple Appointment Options
rules.condition: Specific appointment times are being offered to the patient, and multiple viable options exist based on their preferences and system availability.
rules.action: Present at least two viable date and time options to provide choice and flexibility to the patient.
rules.example: If those times don't work, I also see availability on Wednesday at 10:00 AM or Friday morning at 11:00 AM. How do those sound?

rules.title: Confirm Selected Appointment Details
rules.condition: Patient has indicated a preference for a specific appointment slot (date and time) and medical process.
rules.action: Restate the chosen medical process, date, and time to the patient and confirm their selection.
rules.example: Just to confirm, you'd like to book a [Medical Process] on [Date] at [Time]? Is that correct?

rules.title: Obtain Final Booking Approval
rules.condition: Patient has confirmed their selected appointment details and is ready for the booking to be finalized.
rules.action: Request a clear, final verbal confirmation from the patient to proceed with the booking, reiterating the complete booking details.
rules.example: Excellent. So that's a [Medical Process] for [Patient Name] on [Date] at [Time]. Does that all look correct for me to finalize the booking now?

rules.title: Use Polite and Clear Language
rules.condition: Throughout all interactions with the patient
rules.action: Maintain polite, respectful, and clear language.
rules.example: Thank you for your patience while I checked that for you. Is there anything else I can assist with?
